speaker: Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series
text: Ken Lamkin  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    **BRYCE ACADEMY APRIL 3RD, 1967 3 P.M.** _Scene One - School Science Lab - 35 Years Ago The science room is empty.  Two towheaded boys, Frasier and Niles, stick their heads in._

speaker: Frasier
text: There he is, Niles.  That's our Yorick. _The camera pans up to show a small human skull sitting on top of a cabinet._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series

speaker: Niles
text: He's perfect, Frasier!  The missing link to our backyard production of "Hamlet!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly what I was thinking. [_makes a basket with his hands and leans over_] Now get up there.

speaker: Niles
text: Why me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because I'm the director, that's why. _Niles steps onto Frasier's hands and Frasier boosts him onto the shelf of the cabinet._

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on! Just get up there.

speaker: Niles
text: [_strikes a Shakespearean pose_] Alas, poor Yorick.  I knew him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Knock it off! _He bats Niles on the knee, causing him to drop the skull onto Frasier's head, and then onto the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ow! [_picks up the skull_]

speaker: Niles
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: No! _He holds up the skull.  The jaw has fallen off and there is a small crack on the surface._

speaker: Frasier
text: You cracked my skull! _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Cafe Nervosa - Present Day Niles and Daphne are sitting at a table, while Frasier orders at the counter. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_speaking quickly_] Yes, may I get a double latte please, one shot of decaf espresso, one shot of regular espresso, with some steamed low-fat milk and some non-fat foam?

speaker: Barista
text: [_staring right back_] Sure.

speaker: Niles
text: Well?

speaker: Frasier
text: He didn't even blink an eye.  The man's unflappable.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's amazing, isn't he?

speaker: Niles
text: He made me a chai spice _ristretto americano con panna_ as if people had been drinking them for centuries.

speaker: Frasier
text: Truly this is a golden age.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, did Dad tell you?  Our old house is on the market.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but it doesn't surprise me.  That whole area's undergoing what they call a "revitalization."  Of course, they'll probably just tear it down and put up a Bennetton, or Bath & Body Works, or Sunglass Hut.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I sort of like Bath & Body Works.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do too.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I had this crazy thought, Frasier.  What if we bought the house?

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean as a rental property?

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps, or as a guest _maisonette_ for our out-of-town visitors?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne's mother, perhaps?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I hadn't thought of that!

speaker: Daphne
text: That's a good idea.  Buy her a house and she'll never leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, we could open it up to the general public.

speaker: Niles
text: That's not a bad idea.  A warm bed...

speaker: Frasier
text: A freshly-baked scone...

speaker: Niles
text: For a moderate fee...

speaker: Frasier
text: It could pay for itself...

speaker: Niles
text: As a B & B!

speaker: Daphne
text: If you two break into song, I'm leaving.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello, everybody.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, listen to this!

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right.  Here, have a seat. [_pulls out her chair_]

speaker: Roz
text: I just bought Alice a new hamster, and it's kept me up all night just running around that squeaky damn wheel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you get it a quieter wheel?

speaker: Niles
text: Or oil the squeak.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or take the wheel out at night.

speaker: Barista
text: [_bringing Frasier's coffee_] Or put the cage in another room?

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  Where were you all at 3:00 this morning, when I was trying to shove a Sominex into a carrot?

speaker: Daphne
text: I used to have the same problem when I was raising show rats.

speaker: Niles
text: You don't mean the nasty, plague-propagating vermin, do you?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  I mean purebred rats, as in Siamese or Himalayan or Husky. My most prized one was an Andalusian Blue named Lady Prissy - and she wasn't sick a day in her life, so don't go blaming all rats because of a few bad apples!

speaker: Frasier
text: A few bad apples?  Daphne, they spread a disease that nearly wiped out half the population of Europe!

speaker: Daphne
text: Shows what you know.  Those were common European brown rats.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but the point is-

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no, no, no!  I'll sit here and listen to you prattle on about wine and opera.  But when it comes to rats, you're in my house.  [_N.B. History has taken it for granted that the Black Death was bubonic plague, which would have been spread by ticks and fleas jumping off the hides of rats.  However, recent research has suggested that the Black Death might actually have been a form of anthrax, in which case the rats were innocent and the cows were to blame._] _FADE TO:  Scene Three - The Lasskopf House Frasier, Martin and Niles walk up to the front door._

speaker: Martin
text: Old Man Lasskopf must have owned this place fifty years. Wonder why he's selling?

speaker: Frasier
text: Probably because he can get fifty times what he paid for it.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he sure knew how to squeeze a penny.  You know, he never gave me back my security deposit.  I might just bring that up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, you won't.  Once we turn this place into a B&B;, we'll make it all back in tips.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell is that supposed to mean-?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mr. Lasskopf!  So good to see you again, it's been a long time.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: What has?

speaker: Niles
text: We used to rent this house from you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, I'm Niles Crane, this is my brother, Frasier, and our dad. Do you remember?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: [_looking at Frasier_] Nope. [_at Niles_] Nope. [_at Martin_] You sort of look familiar.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I should.  I paid you rent for ten years, left the place in perfect condition, and you never gave me back my security deposit.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Nope, don't remember you either.  Come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: Go ahead, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh boy, this brings back memories.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, do you remember doing our homework up here at the dining room table?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, and afternoon piano lessons...

speaker: Martin
text: Getting haircuts from your mother...

speaker: Frasier
text: And Mom's roll-top desk on this wall over here.

speaker: Niles
text: Where we wrote all the "Crane Boys Mysteries."  I can still see you pacing in your writer's tweeds and half-glasses, dictating.

speaker: Frasier
text: And you in your shawl-collar sweater, hammering away at the keys of that old Royal typewriter.

speaker: Niles
text: Gosh, when did those two crazy kids become such a pair of old fuddy-duddies?  [_N.B. See[[8.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_19/daphne_returns.html "Daphne Returns") "Daphne Returns," for the introduction of the Crane Boys Mysteries._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles!  Do you remember?  Here's the window we used to sneak out of after curfew. [_opens it_]

speaker: Martin
text: Really, you did?  I never knew that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure, Dad, we, uh, we used to go out and, uh, chase the girls, and, uh, get a drink or two.

speaker: Martin
text: Well! [_to Lasskopf_] Boys will be boys.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: We didn't chase girls, we went out to foreign films.

speaker: Frasier
text: You think Dad wants to hear that?  Throw the guy a bone.

speaker: Martin
text: So, what made you finally decide to sell?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Moving to the Cayman Islands.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa, that'll be a change from Seattle.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Gee, you think?

speaker: Martin
text: I hear they have great scuba diving down there.  You scuba?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Do I look like I scuba?  I'm lucky I don't need a tank to breathe on land.

speaker: Martin
text: Just looking for a change of scenery, huh?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Looking to be left alone.  I'm not what you call a real social type.

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns away, muttering_] You sure made friends with my security deposit.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, you're right.  It's not big enough for a bed-and-breakfast.

speaker: Niles
text: No, but it did give us a nice walk down memory lane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes... Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't we stash a memory box underneath one of these floorboards right around here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought you took that with you when we moved.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you took it!  Do you suppose it's still here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it must be!

speaker: Frasier
text: Mr. Lasskopf, uh, would you mind if my brother and I had a look underneath one of the floorboards here?  You see, we left a sort of time capsule underneath there.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: No, you don't.  Nobody's pulling up any floor here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no, we don't need to.  The board was always loose.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: There's no loose boards.  They've all been nailed down, I made sure of that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, couldn't we just check?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Look, I came here to sell this place, not have it torn apart. Now are you serious buyers, or are we wasting our time here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, allowing us to reclaim a small part of our past is hardly a waste of time.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Well, it sounds like a load of tomfoolery to me.  Let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mr. Lasskopf, I assure you, my brother and I give tomfoolery no quarter!  We never have!

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Oh, no?  What do you call sneaking out to drink and chase girls?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, that wasn't true!  We went out to see foreign films.

speaker: Martin
text: I knew it. _Mr. Lasskopf opens the door, and Martin walks out.  Frasier and Niles follow him, protesting.  FADE TO:_ **IF THESE FLOORS COULD TALK** _Scene Four - The Lasskopf House - Night Someone jimmies open the sneak-window from outside.  A hand comes in with a valise full of tools, drops it on the floor, then withdraws. Then Frasier and Niles climb in.  Both are dressed in dark sweaters and carrying flashlights._

speaker: Niles
text: There we go.  Well done, Frasier.  You've still got it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  Like riding a bicycle. _Each of them sweeps the room with his flashlight, then puts it away and lights a lantern._

speaker: Niles
text: Here we go...

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let's just find our memory box and get the hell out of here.  I think it's around... here somewhere.

speaker: Niles
text: I've got it, I've got it, I've got it.  This one.

speaker: Frasier
text: See if I can get this in here... [_does_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that's it.  There it is, there it is, good.

speaker: Niles
text: A-ha, well done, Frasier.  Yeah, I think that's as far as it'll go.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, reach your hand in there and see what you can find.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not going to put my hand down there, there could be rats.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe they're just down-on-their-luck show rats!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, what was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't ask me, you're marrying her.  All right, I'll do it.

speaker: Niles
text: Careful, careful.  All right, all right [_looking over his shoulder_] I can't see anything.  Oh, it's not there, is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, hang on a minute.  Hang on - wait, wait, wait!

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got, I've got - there's something... here it is. _His hand comes up holding a small human skull, browned with age. The jaw is missing and the surface is cracked.  They both start and yell._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, Niles!  Look...

speaker: Niles
text: [_recoils_] Don't give it to me!  Is that real?

speaker: Frasier
text: It certainly feels real.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what's it doing under the floor?

speaker: Frasier
text: How the hell should I know?  I wonder who it could be?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps it's a builder who got trapped during construction, or a, an exterminator who was overcome with fumes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent hypotheses, Niles.  But unfortunately, neither is plausible.

speaker: Niles
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because, Niles, when you die, your head doesn't pop off like a champagne cork! It remains attached to the spine.  And look here, Niles.  The temporal bone has been fractured... as if struck by a blunt object.

speaker: Niles
text: So perhaps the poor fellow met his end in some-some sort of violent accident.

speaker: Frasier
text: Violent, yes.  But an accident? _Zoom in on Niles' horror-struck (yet excited) face.  They both take on voices a la Vincent Price._

speaker: Niles
text: _Murder!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Murder most _foul._  [_With apologies to Dame Agatha._] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Five - Apartment That same night at home, Martin is watching TV.  Daphne opens the door to Roz and Alice._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey Roz, Alice, come on in. [_they do_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.  Is Frasier home?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he and Niles went out - wine club or something.

speaker: Roz
text: Uh, he'll be back soon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hard to say.  Is everything all right?  You seem a little edgy.

speaker: Roz
text: [_lowers voice_] Can I talk to you in the kitchen?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course.

speaker: Roz
text: Martin, can Alice watch TV with you for a second?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure she can.

speaker: Martin
text: What kind of TV do you like?

speaker: Alice
text: Cartoons.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, really?  Your mom lets you watch that stuff - the anvils and dynamite, and people falling over cliffs and things? [_Alice nods_] Great, then you should be all over this hockey game.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, what's up?

speaker: Roz
text: Do you remember Alice's hamster I told you about?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, still keeping you awake?

speaker: Roz
text: Not anymore.  The dog ate it.  Well, half of it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no. Something like that happened when I was a girl.  One of our cats got into one of my rat cages and took little old Pink Bottom right out of show business.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I don't mind the hamster dying.  I just don't know how to break it to Alice.  She's never had anything die before.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, how did you parents explain it to you?

speaker: Roz
text: [_exhales_] The wrong way.  When I was six, my canary died. And that evening, my dad sat on the bed next to me and said, "dying is just going to sleep and never waking up."  Then he turned off the light and said good night.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sure Dr. Crane will have some good advice on how to handle this.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  I mean, I know we kid him and stuff, but when it comes right down to it, he's one of the smartest people I know. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Six - Lasskopf House Frasier gazes at the skull held up in his left hand.  Niles stands behind him with a white cloth for handling it._

speaker: Frasier
text: One thing is certain: someone is very dead.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Poirot, you've done it again.  Look, can we just put that thing down and call the police?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, hang on a minute, Niles!  I mean, this skull's been underneath there for a long time now, what's another hour going to hurt?  Niles, we have a real Crane Boys Mystery here.  Why don't we see if we can dig up a few more clues?

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, all right, fair enough.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here.

speaker: Niles
text: So, uh, what do we know?  We have a victim - or part of one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Correct.  Can we establish motive?

speaker: Niles
text: Not without knowing who the victim is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Correct.  Can we establish opportunity?

speaker: Niles
text: Whose opportunity?

speaker: Frasier
text: Whose indeed?  It would have to be someone who's had access to this house over the years.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes well, we can rule out Mom and Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: And of course what would you and I be doing with a human skull?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes_] Oh wait, Niles! [_laughs_] Oh, dear God, we're idiots.

speaker: Niles
text: [_still as investigator_] Why are we idiots?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, use your brain!  Think back... to elementary school.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not following.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't you remember?  That was about the time when...

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Lasskopf disappeared.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God, you're right.  And-and you know, they used to fight all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and then suddenly she stopped coming around.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I always thought that was because they split up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did they?  Or did _he_ split her up?  Cutting off her head and hands, so that the body couldn't be identified by dental records or fingerprints!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, Frasier, that's pretty out there... although it would explain why Lasskopf didn't want us poking around under the floor.  Frasier!  We have a victim and a suspect.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, not so fast, Niles.  Are you forgetting Item One from "Top Truths for Teen Sleuths: A Crane Boys' Mysteries Workbork"?

speaker: Niles
text: "A case is rarely elementary, but-"

speaker: Both
text: "Always evidentiary!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, exactly!  The only evidence we have is the skull.  Niles... hand me those tools.  Unless I miss my guess, this floor isn't done talking! _Niles hands him the crowbar.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Seven - Later Half the floor has been pried up, and all of the walls have been stripped.  Frasier rushes in from the garage carrying a shoebox and his lantern._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you'll never guess what I just found in the...!  Niles, where are you?! _In a scene right out of "The Case of the Red-Headed League," Niles's head emerges from the hole in the floor with his lantern._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm here!  I found our memory box, [_lifts it out_] and I think... [_holds up a large rock_] this rock could be the murder weapon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why that rock instead of all the other rocks down there?

speaker: Niles
text: It's pointier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Drop the rock, Niles.  The garage has given up something far more interesting. _Niles does, and climbs out.  Frasier opens the shoe box and unfolds a bank statement._

speaker: Frasier
text: Take a look at this financial statement.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gasps_] It appears the Lasskopfs had quite a windfall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and it was just before the time they asked us to leave.

speaker: Niles
text: [_stands up_] I see, I see.  So, he killed her, collected the insurance money, and then evicted us, so he'd have a safe place to dispose of the body!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bravo, Niles!  But no!  Insurance is messy.  They always require a body and a death certificate before they'll pay off.  And messier still, he would have had to kill her, conceal the body, get rid of us, and then bring the body back here.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if that's not insurance, then...? [_sees Frasier's expectant look_] Inheritance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!  Her parents die, and leave everything to her.  Which means that now the Lasskopfs want for nothing, but she's the provider.

speaker: Niles
text: And never misses an opportunity to remind him of it.  He's emasculated!

speaker: Frasier
text: Desperately!  [_N.B. Shades of Maris._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And so, he hatches a plan.  "Darling, why don't we evict the Cranes?  We don't need their rent money anymore." _This kills me - Niles holds up the skull and speaks through it like Senor Wences._

speaker: Niles
text: [_old lady voice_] "No, thanks to my family's frugal nature and untimely death."

speaker: Frasier
text: And so, out go the Cranes, and the house is empty.  "Darling, why don't we go see in what condition the Cranes have left the house, hmm?"

speaker: Niles
text: "You go, you lazy parasite, I'm having my nails done!" [_off Frasier's look_] I mean, "OK!" _Niles puts down the skull and goes to Frasier's side, as if they are the Lasskopfs walking through the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: So... in they stroll - he with murderous intent, she with nary an inkling of the tragedy about to befall her.

speaker: Frasier
text: He pretends to inspect the house... "Darling, why what's this mark over here on the wall?" [_points to the wall_]

speaker: Niles
text: "Where?" [_walks over to the wall_]

speaker: Frasier
text: "There, look." [_Niles bends over_] "Closer, closer..." And as she leans in... [_comes up behind Niles_] he does her in!

speaker: Niles
text: "No, Alfred, no!" [_normal voice_] - oh, that makes perfect sense.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  We have a victim, we have a motive, and we have evidence for both!

speaker: Niles
text: If only we had a murder weapon to tie it all together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't you remember?  As in many a Crane Boys case, the absence of a weapon does not mean the absence of a crime! Perhaps he pushed her down the stairs, as in "The Case of the Unhappy Landing!"

speaker: Niles
text: I always thought the title gave it away.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.  Well, then we can rename it once we have them published.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think that would ever happen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you kidding?  Once this hits the papers?! _FADE TO:  Scene Eight - Apartment Martin is dozing in his Chair.  Alice is asleep on the couch. Daphne tiptoes in with the laundry basket and wakes him up._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_whispering_] I'm just gonna go down and check on the laundry. If Alice wakes up, keep an eye on her, will you?

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to Roz?

speaker: Daphne
text: Alice's hamster died, so Roz just stepped out to the pet store to get her a new one.

speaker: Martin
text: Sure, no problem.

speaker: Alice
text: Where's Mommy?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hi, hon.  Uh, your mom'll be right back.

speaker: Alice
text: Can we watch hockey?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, no, the game's over, sweetheart.  Canadiens won, by the way, so you owe me ten bucks.  [_N.B. So cute - but where does a three year-old find ten dollars to call her own?_]

speaker: Alice
text: I miss my hamster.

speaker: Martin
text: I know you do, sweetheart. [_lifts her onto his lap_] and I'm sure he's up in Hamster Heaven missing you too.

speaker: Alice
text: What is Hamster Heaven?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's where hamsters go when they die.

speaker: Alice
text: Mommy said he was lost.

speaker: Martin
text: [_realizes_] Oh, oh... oh, no.

speaker: Alice
text: When will he come back?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, boy.  Well... when a hamster goes to hamster heaven, it can't come back.  But that's OK.

speaker: Alice
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, 'cause it's great up there.  They got exercise wheels on every corner, and the streets are paved with... what do hamsters eat?

speaker: Alice
text: Hamster food.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah well, that's what the streets are paved with.  And there aren't any cats to chase them.

speaker: Alice
text: Does cats have a heaven too?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure!  Yeah, same deal, except no wheels, and their streets are paved with fish.

speaker: Alice
text: [_looks at Eddie_] What about dogs?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, dogs too.  Just about all animals have a heaven.

speaker: Alice
text: Is Eddie going?

speaker: Martin
text: [_surprised, laughs_] Oh, no!  Not-not Eddie.  Not for a long time anyway.  I mean, he's really still just a puppy.

speaker: Alice
text: How old is he?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, he's about ten.

speaker: Alice
text: That's not a puppy!

speaker: Martin
text: Well... uh, hey, why don't we see if there are any cartoons on TV? _As he picks up the remote, Daphne enters with the laundry, followed by Roz carrying a hamster in a cage._

speaker: Daphne
text: Look who's here.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, everybody!  Look, Alice!  Look what Mommy found.

speaker: Alice
text: A new hamster!

speaker: Roz
text: New?  What makes you think he's new?

speaker: Alice
text: Because animals don't come back from heaven.  Right, Uncle Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Right. [_to Roz_] We sort of had a little talk.

speaker: Roz
text: You what?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, uh, look, I didn't mean-

speaker: Roz
text: Having little talks with Alice is my territory, not yours.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look, uh, it was an accident.  Like I said, I'm sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay. [_lowers voice_] But death is a tough concept for a kid, I don't want her to be scared or confused.

speaker: Alice
text: [_re: hamster_] I like this one better.

speaker: Roz
text: [_chuckles_] Well, I guess she'll pull through. [_touches his shoulder_] Thanks for handling it.

speaker: Martin
text: No problem.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Alice.  Goodnight, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Goodnight, Roz.  Goodnight, Alice.

speaker: Alice
text: Goodnight, Uncle Martin.  Bye, Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: Here, boy. _Eddie runs over and jumps into Martin's lap.  Martin looks at him thoughtfully for a moment, then kisses his head and hugs him tightly.  FADE TO:  Scene Nine - Lasskopf House Frasier and Niles stand in the middle of the room as policemen photograph and tag the crime scene.  Squad cars are heard outside.  A policeman brings in Mr. Lasskopf by the arm._

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Oh my God!  My house!  What have you done to my house?

speaker: Cop
text: Is this the man you told me about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is, Officer.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: Well, what the hell's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: We dug up your wife, that's what's going on!

speaker: Lasskopf
text: [_horrified_] You dug up my wife?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll bet you thought nobody ever would, didn't you?

speaker: Lasskopf
text: [_truthfully_] No!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you didn't count on the Crane boys.

speaker: Lasskopf
text: But, uh... how could you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, a little luck and some simple deductive reasoning.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's enough questions out of you!  I think this officer here has a few questions he'd like to ask you himself.

speaker: Cop
text: That's right, sir.  Come this way, Mr. Lasskopf.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice work, men.  Well, Niles, another Crane Boys Mystery solved.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait'll we tell Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, we almost forgot our memory box. [_chuckles_] You know, we never even looked inside.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, look.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... this is the program for our backyard production of "Hamlet!" [_lifts it out_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd totally forgotten about that!

speaker: Niles
text: So had I! _Niles opens the program... and then shuts it, both of them looking up as it finally clicks._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles... we may owe Mr. Lasskopf an apology. _Niles replaces the program in the box. Glancing at the policeman still photographing the house, Frasier mouths, "let's go!" and they slip out as quietly as possible.  END OF ACT TWO_
